snippet: On Tuesday, his last day in office, Gov. Haley Barbour of Mississippi granted full and unconditional pardons to 193 criminals.
abstract: Mississippi Gov Haley Barbour grants full and unconditional pardons to 193 criminals on his last day in office, an unusually high number for the state, and one that is likely to inflame controversy about his pardon practices; he had previously pardoned five convicted murderers.

byline.contributor: Robbie Brown and Whitney Boyd contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, his last day in office, Gov. Haley Barbour of Mississippi granted full and unconditional pardons to 193 criminals.

headline.seo: Gov. Haley Barbour of Mississippi Is Criticized on Wave of Pardons
headline.main: Mississippi Governor, Already Criticized on Pardons, Rides a Wave of Them Out of Office
headline.print_headline: Mississippi Governor, Already Criticized on Pardons, Rides a Wave of Them Out of Office
